title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
Code
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))


       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \

2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page analyzes changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population in Canada from 1952 to 2007.


Code
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

canada = df[df['country'] == 'Canada']

fig, axs = plt.subplots(3, 1, figsize=(8, 12), sharex=True)

axs[0].plot(canada['year'], canada['life_expectancy'], color='blue')
axs[0].set_ylabel('Life Expectancy')
axs[0].set_title('Life Expectancy in Canada')

axs[1].plot(canada['year'], canada['gdp_per_capita'], color='green')
axs[1].set_ylabel('GDP per Capita')
axs[1].set_title('GDP per Capita in Canada')

axs[2].plot(canada['year'], canada['population_millions'], color='orange')
axs[2].set_ylabel('Population (Millions)')
axs[2].set_title('Population in Canada')
axs[2].set_xlabel('Year')

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()





Life Expectancy vs. GDP

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page details the relationship between Life Expectancy and GDP for 142 countries from 1952 to 2007.


Code
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

plt.scatter(df['gdp_per_capita'], df['life_expectancy'], alpha=0.6)
plt.xlabel('GDP per Capita')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs. GDP per Capita')
plt.xscale('log')
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()





Life Expectancy vs. GDP

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This page details the relationship between Life Expectancy and Population (in millions) for 142 countries from 1952 to 2007.


Code
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

plt.scatter(df['population_millions'], df['life_expectancy'], alpha=0.6)
plt.xlabel('Population in Millions')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs. Population in Millions')
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()





Life Expectancy vs. Population

title: Gapminder Dataset Analysis
text:
The Gapminder dataset contains social and economic data for 142 countries across the globe, from the years 1952 to 2007.
